definition: to pretend to understand when you don't
(negative prefix)/not/no
to understand/to comprehend
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to understand/to comprehend

sentences.english: Really is does not understand pretends to understand the girl.
sentences.chinese: 真是個不懂裝懂的女孩。

sentences.english: Those who pretend to know what they don't know will be punished .
sentences.chinese: 不懂裝懂的人總有一天會受到懲罰。

sentences.english: There is no more shameful act than pretending to know what one does not.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比不懂裝懂更讓人感到恥辱。

sentences.english: Try to hear the meaning behind the words without presuming you already know.
sentences.chinese: 不要不懂裝懂，儘量聽出言外之意。

sentences.english: We’re all faking it, and hoping we’re getting it right.
sentences.chinese: 我們所有人不懂裝懂，並希望自己都是正確的。

sentences.english: Remember, pretending to be know-it-all will bring troubles.
sentences.chinese: 切記，不懂裝懂會帶來麻煩的。

sentences.english: Because he's aware of his ignorance, he doesn't act with foolish confidence.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他能認識到自己的無知，不會不懂裝懂意氣用事。

sentences.english: If you pretend to know what you don't know, you'll only make a fool of yourself.
Unqualified opinions just make a person sound foolishly arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 不懂裝懂的意見只會讓一個人聽上去愚蠢而自大。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: vain
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue

definition: it's nothing personal (idiom)
(coll.) lowest-ranking (student, participant etc)/to rank at the bottom of the list/to finish last
female gossip/busybody
annoying/disgusting
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to make a fool of oneself
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to haggle over every cent (idiom)
